item.title: 莫斯科法院对未遵守俄罗斯互联网规则的 Zoom 公司处以罚款
item.description: 莫斯科法院新闻处周二表示，俄罗斯法院对 Zoom Communications 公司处以 7960 万卢布（约合 965779 美元）的罚款，原因是该公司未能遵守有关在俄罗斯互联网空间运营的外国实体的法律规定。【原文：A Russian court has fined Zoom Communications 79.6 million roubles ($965,779) for failing to comply with legal requirements governing foreign entities operating in Russia's internet space, the Moscow courts press service said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 矿业巨头墨西哥集团第二季度利润增长 10
item.description: 墨西哥矿业和运输集团 Grupo Mexico 公布的第二季度净利润攀升 10%，达到 12.3 亿美元。【原文：Mining and transportation conglomerate Grupo Mexico reported a second-quarter net profit that climbed 10%, coming in at $1.23 billion.】

item.title: 建材制造商 CRH 将以 21 亿美元收购 Eco Material
item.description: 建筑材料制造商华润集团（CRH）周二表示，已同意以 21 亿美元的价格收购水泥基辅助材料供应商 Eco Material Technologies，以扩大其在北美的业务。【原文：Building materials maker CRH said on Tuesday it has agreed to acquire Eco Material Technologies, a supplier of supplementary cementitious materials, for $2.1 billion to expand its presence in North America.】

item.title: VIEW 对诺和诺德新任首席执行官和盈利预警的反应
item.description: 诺和诺德周二任命内部人士迈克-杜斯塔尔（Mike Doustdar）为新任首席执行官，此前这家丹麦肥胖症药物生产商在2025年第二次下调了全年业绩展望，导致股价暴跌。【原文：Novo Nordisk on Tuesday appointed insider Mike Doustdar as its new chief executive after the Danish obesity drug maker cut its full year outlook for the second time in 2025, sending its shares tumbling.】

item.title: 糖果巨头玛氏公司将在 2026 年前向美国制造业再投资 20 亿美元
item.description: 糖果和零食巨头玛氏公司周二宣布，计划到明年再向其美国业务投资 20 亿美元，以支持该公司在美国扩大生产的持续努力。【原文：Candy and snacks giant Mars on Tuesday announced plans to invest $2 billion more in its U.S. operations through next year to bolster the company's ongoing efforts to expand manufacturing in the country.】

item.title: 商务部长卢特尼克表示，特朗普将在 8 月 1 日前决定贸易协议
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周二表示，在特朗普自行设定的8月1日最后期限到来之前，即使与中国和欧盟的单独谈判仍在继续，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普也将在本周做出贸易协议决定。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump will make his trade deal decisions this week even as separate negotiations with China and the European Union continue, U.S. Commerce chief Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday ahead of Trump's self-imposed Aug. 1 deadline.】

item.title: 安捷伦科技公司首席执行官表示，希望将在印度的投资翻番，并着眼于高速增长
item.description: 总部位于美国的实验室设备制造商安捷伦科技公司（Agilent Technologies）的一位高层管理人员表示，该公司计划将其在印度的投资增加一倍，以拓展其增长最快的市场之一。【原文：U.S.-based laboratory equipment maker Agilent Technologies plans to double its investments in India to expand in one of its fastest-growing markets, a top executive said.】

item.title: 消息人士称印度为美国提高关税做好准备，期待达成更广泛的贸易协议
item.description: 两位印度政府消息人士称，印度正准备对其部分出口商品征收更高的美国关税（可能在20%至25%之间），作为一项临时措施，因为印度将在华盛顿8月1日的最后期限之前暂不做出新的贸易让步。【原文：India is preparing to face higher U.S. tariffs — likely between 20% and 25% — on some of its exports as a temporary measure, as it holds off on fresh trade concessions ahead of Washington's August 1 deadline, two Indian government sources said.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）小幅上调 2025 年经济增长预期，警告关税风险仍阻碍经济前景
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）周二略微调高了对2025年和2026年全球经济增长的预测，原因是在8月1日美国关税跳升之前，采购量强于预期，而且美国的有效关税率从24.4%降至17.3%。【原文：The IMF on Tuesday edged its global growth forecast slightly higher for 2025 and 2026 given stronger-than-expected purchases ahead of an August 1 jump in U.S. tariffs and a drop in the effective U.S. tariff rate to 17.3% from 24.4%.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）上调新兴经济体 2025 年国内生产总值（GDP）展望，对中国的看法有所改善
item.description: 国际货币基金组织将今年新兴市场和发展中经济体的经济增长预期从 3.7%上调至 4.1%，主要是受前期加载和对中国更乐观看法的推动。【原文：The International Monetary Fund raised its outlook for economic growth across emerging market and developing economies this year to 4.1% from 3.7%, driven by frontloading and a more upbeat view on China.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）警告：中央银行失去独立性可能导致不稳定
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周二警告说，任何中央银行丧失独立性的行为都可能破坏控制通胀预期的努力，从而可能引发金融、货币和宏观经济不稳定的浪潮。【原文：The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday warned that any loss of central bank independence could undermine efforts to keep inflation expectations in check, potentially triggering a wave of financial, monetary and macroeconomic instability.】

item.title: 在普世要求更多时间后，欧盟将达成市中心协议的最后期限延长至 12 月 10 日
item.description: 欧盟委员会网站显示，在环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）旗下维珍音乐集团（Virgin Music Group）斥资 7.75 亿美元竞购下城音乐公司（Downtown Music）一事上，欧盟反垄断监管机构已将决定截止日期延长至 12 月 10 日，此前环球音乐集团要求更多时间。【原文：EU antitrust regulators have extended their decision deadline on a $775-million bid by Universal Music Group unit Virgin Music Group for Downtown Music to December 10, after Universal asked for more time, the European Commission website showed.】

item.title: 数据中心需求强劲，电力设备制造商 Hubbell 上调年度盈利预期
item.description: 电气设备制造商 Hubbell 周二上调了全年盈利预期，看好人工智能所需的数据中心对产品的强劲需求。【原文：Electrical equipment maker Hubbell raised its full-year profit forecast on Tuesday, betting on strong demand for products used by data centers needed for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 美国 6 月商品贸易逆差大幅收窄
item.description: 在进口下降的情况下，美国 6 月份的货物贸易逆差大幅缩减，巩固了经济学家的预期，即贸易可能是第二季度经济增长反弹的主要原因。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit in goods contracted sharply in June amid a decline in imports, cementing economists' expectations that trade likely accounted for much of an anticipated rebound in economic growth in the second quarter.】

item.title: 熟悉情况的消息人士称，周一发生大规模枪击事件后，Blackstone 关闭了曼哈顿办事处
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，投资公司 Blackstone 表示，在周一发生造成数人死亡的大规模枪击事件后，其曼哈顿办事处将于周二关闭。【原文：Investment company Blackstone said its Manhattan offices will be closed Tuesday after Monday's mass shooting that killed several people, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，微软正在就继续使用 OpenAI 技术进行深入谈判
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引两位熟悉谈判情况的人士的话报道，微软正在就一项交易进行深入谈判，该交易将使这家 Windows 制造商在未来继续获得关键的 OpenAI 技术。【原文：Microsoft is in advanced talks for a deal that would give the Windows maker continued access to critical OpenAI technology in the future, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing two people familiar with the negotiations.】

item.title: 公司称，曼哈顿枪击案死者中包括 Blackstone 高管
item.description: 投资巨头黑石集团（Blackstone Inc）周二表示，周一一名持冲锋枪的枪手走进曼哈顿中城一栋办公楼的大厅并开火，造成一名高级管理人员死亡。【原文：Investment giant Blackstone Inc said on Tuesday that a senior executive was among the people killed when a gunman, carrying an assault rifle, walked into the lobby of a midtown Manhattan office building and opened fire on Monday.】

item.title: 无线运营商争夺基础设施，美国塔台上调 2025 年物业收入预期
item.description: 周二，无线基础设施供应商美国铁塔公司（American Tower）上调了其年度房地产收入预期，押注于无线运营商健康的租赁活动。【原文：Wireless infrastructure provider American Tower raised its annual property revenue forecast on Tuesday, betting on healthy leasing activity by wireless carriers.】

item.title: 英伟达支持的 Enfabrica 发布旨在降低内存成本的系统
item.description: 致力于解决人工智能数据中心瓶颈问题的硅谷芯片初创公司 Enfabrica 周二发布了一个芯片和软件系统，旨在控制这些中心的存储芯片成本。【原文：Enfabrica, a Silicon Valley-based chip startup working on solving bottlenecks in artificial intelligence data centers, on Tuesday released a chip-and-software system aimed at reining in the cost of memory chips in those centers.】

item.title: 受人工智能需求驱动，康宁公司预计本季度核心销售额将有所增长
item.description: 本周二，特种玻璃制造商康宁公司预计第三季度核心销售额将高于华尔街预期，主要原因是人工智能带动了对其光连接产品的需求。【原文：Specialty glass maker Corning forecast third-quarter core sales above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, led by artificial intelligence-driven demand for its optical connectivity products.】

item.title: 美国需求复苏，捷蓝航空亏损低于预期
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）周二公布的第二季度调整后亏损小于华尔街预期，主要得益于成本削减措施和美国旅游需求的恢复。【原文：JetBlue Airways on Tuesday posted an adjusted loss for the second quarter that was smaller than Wall Street expectations, helped by cost cutting measures and recovering demand for travel in the U.S.】

item.title: 飞机交付量增加，波音亏损减少
item.description: 周二，波音公司公布第二季度亏损减少，原因是这家美国飞机制造商从质量和监管危机以及去年导致大部分生产停顿的大罢工中恢复过来，加大了喷气机的生产和交付力度。【原文：Boeing reported a smaller second-quarter loss on Tuesday as the U.S. planemaker ramped up jet production and deliveries, recovering from a quality and regulatory crisis and a major strike that halted most production last year.】

item.title: 重塑美国货运网络的重大铁路合并案
item.description: 联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific）周二表示，它将以 850 亿美元的价格收购规模较小的竞争对手诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern），从而创建该国第一家海岸至海岸货运铁路运营商。【原文：Union Pacific said on Tuesday it would buy smaller rival Norfolk Southern in an $85-billion deal to create the country's first coast-to-coast freight rail operator.】

item.title: 基因疗法 Elevidys 在美国恢复发货后，Sarepta 公司股价反弹
item.description: 周二收盘前，Sarepta Therapeutics 公司股价大涨超过 30%，原因是分析师称其肌肉基因疗法在美国恢复出货部分消除了财务阻力，并降低了退出市场的风险。【原文：Sarepta Therapeutics shares surged more than 30% before the bell on Tuesday, as analysts said the resumption of U.S. shipments for its muscular gene therapy partially removes financial headwinds and decreases the risk of market withdrawal.】

item.title: 铁路运营商诺福克南方公司季度利润增长
item.description: 本周二，诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）公布第二季度利润增长，主要得益于销量增长带来的收入增加。【原文：Norfolk Southern reported a rise in its second-quarter profit on Tuesday, aided by higher revenue from improved volumes.】

item.title: 金管局称明年初可能发放首批香港稳定币牌照
item.description: 香港金融管理局（HKMA）周二在媒体吹风会上表示，首批香港稳定币发行商牌照预计将于明年年初发放。【原文：The first batch of Hong Kong stablecoin issuer licences is expected to be granted early next year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) told a media briefing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 随着扭亏步伐加快，PayPal 将 2025 年利润预期上调至高于预期的水平
item.description: PayPal 周二上调了全年利润预期，高于华尔街预期，因为这家数字支付巨头推动 Venmo 和美国结账等高利润业务恢复增长的努力已初见成效。【原文：PayPal raised its full-year profit forecast above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, as the digital payments giant's push to revive growth in high-margin businesses such as Venmo and U.S. checkout begins to pay off.】

item.title: 肥胖症药物制造商诺和诺德下调2025年销售额增长和营业利润展望
item.description: 肥胖症药品制造商诺和诺德公司周二警告说，全年销售额和营业利润的增长将低于此前的预期，这是该公司在2025年第二次下调预期。【原文：Obesity drugmaker Novo Nordisk warned on Tuesday that full-year sales and operating profit would grow less than previously expected, marking its second forecast cut of 2025.】

item.title: 宝洁公司在领导层变动和关税影响下发出年度增长乏力的信号
item.description: 在汰渍母公司任命一位内部人士担任首席执行官，以指导公司度过关税不确定性的一天之后，宝洁公司周二预测，面对谨慎的消费者，公司的年度业绩将大大低于华尔街的预期。【原文：Procter & Gamble on Tuesday forecast annual results largely below Wall Street estimates in the face of cautious consumers, a day after the Tide parent named an insider as CEO to steer it through the tariff uncertainty.】

item.title: 联合太平洋公司将以 850 亿美元收购诺福克铁路公司
item.description: 联合太平洋铁路公司（Union Pacific）周二表示，将以 850 亿美元的价格收购规模较小的竞争对手诺福克南方铁路公司（Norfolk Southern），从而创建美国第一家海岸到海岸货运铁路运营商，并重塑全国从谷物到汽车的货物运输。【原文：Union Pacific said on Tuesday it would buy smaller rival Norfolk Southern in an $85 billion deal, to create the nation's first coast-to-coast freight rail operator and reshape the movement of goods from grains to autos across the country.】
